page.title: 15EVENTS_THE CHARTER FAIR 1985
page.content: The Charter Fair is held to celebrate when Northleach was given a charter, when it was a big wool town. The square was busy the night before when everything was getting ready. The day's main events were in the playing fields with a car boot sale sale and other stalls. There was a carnival, a motorbike display, a human bomb, and a clown. The best part of the fair was the disco and the events in the evening. The first event was the wellie walk where teams of 4 wearing wellies tied together visited each pub and drank a pint of beer at each. A big disco was held in the square with music played off the back off a lorry. There was also a country and western band for some of the time. The fair went on for most of the night. It was brilliant.
